intro: Aethionema semnanensis, commonly known as the Semnan carnation, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticultural enthusiasts.
